response.overview: Dozens of men, women, and children toil on a large, dusty construction site to produce thousands of bricks—all by hand. A centuries-old process of shaping, cutting, and firing clay—from wet to dry and from brown to red—is revealed in stunning beauty in this short film. Wagons full of bricks are transported day and night, in blazing sun and refreshing rain.
response.title: A Tale of Bricks

release_dates.note: Kassel Documentary Film and Video Festival
